result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Lawhorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Heather Lawhorn in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:56 PM. Burns has handed court a plea questionnaire. State - there is an agreement, defendant would plead guilty to count 1 as alleged and sentence to following. Count 1  w/held sentence and place on probation for 1 year with following conditions: AODA and follow thru with all recommendations, anger management assessment and follow Thur, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, costs only. Counts 2 & 3 would be DRI. Join in with defense to terminate probation early if she completes all programs.  State has complied with victim notification with no response. Court DRI count 2 & 3. Defendant pleads G to count 1 as alleged. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds defendant is entering her plea freely and voluntarily and waiving right to JT. Factual basis exists, accepts plea and adjudges guilty of count 1 as alleged. Final statement by all parties, defendant makes statement. Court sentences to following: Count 1 - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with following conditions: 35 hours community service, AODA and follow thru follow all aftercare programs, 1 AA/NA meeting per week, anger management assessment and follow thru, no consumption/possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars/taverns, costs only paid thru probation. 2 days credit if revoked. Appeal rights given. Adj.

Defendant Heather Lawhorn in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Heather Lawhorn in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:00 PM. State - here for a return on a warrant. Lawhorn does not have complaint. Ms. Burns given complaint in Court by COC. Court reads charges and penalties. Lawhorn and Burns understand charges and penalties, enters NG to all counts, addresses bond - requests that the previous signature bond be re-instated for stated reasons. State - bond - states concern with signature bond. Burns responds. State - no objections to signature bond. Court - bond - $1000.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and must notify Court and Ms. Burns within 48 hours of any change in address, no violent contact with either victim.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 10-14-2015 09:00 am
Defendant Heather Lawhorn not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State due to no appearance asks for warrant. Court issues bench warrant body or $500.00.
No consumption of alcohol. No abusive contact with either victim.
